reviewText: This workout is fantastic. I own lots of exercise DVDs (from Cathe, Jari, Amy Bento to CIA, Kelly Coffey, Ilaria and everyting in-between), but every time I dig this one back out, I think, wow! this was great. Well-designed, challenging cardio & weights circuit workout in under an hour that is fun and makes you feel great. As far as Firm workouts go, this is definitely one of their best ones. Also, you don't need to have a decline step to do this. A regular step works just fine, or for an extra challenge a BOSU will kick your butt.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The "The Firm Body Sculpting System: Total Muscle Shaping!" is great, makes you sweat, and is great at combining lower and upper body work, along with cardio. Definitely keeps your heart pumping.  My one critique: the women who are in the background are SO completely skinny, it's actually hard to watch them.  Two are bordering on anorexia. The instructor has a beautiful body, you can tell she is healthy and works very hard on her body (outside of the Firm tapes for sure). There is really no reason to have such skinny women on, especially since previous Firm tapes have had nice, healthy, lean, fit women on them. It seems they are sinking to the lowest common denominator. But all in all, a good workout. About 5-10 min of the 40 min total is using the bench on an incline, so if you are like me and don't have the box, you have to improvise. But no big deal, not wasting $30 on a plastic box.
summary: Difficult, powerful, women WAY too skinny.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great workout, that is only 45 minutes total with warm up and cool down. I am an advanced exerciser and I found the Instructor does not give you sufficient time between different exercises. If a beginner exerciser tried to keep up, they may injure themselves. Example, going from lying overhead tricep pull downs to chest flys. Need time to transition from holding 1 weight and 2. I was a sweaty mess though when I was finished, so I'm still pleased with the intensity of the workout.
summary: Great workout, but too fast between sets
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is one of my favorite firm workouts and I have all the workouts there are for bss1,2,3,&4.  I now use the transfirmer with bss3 workouts.  works great. More stable.  This workout is great.  Gets my heart rate up and breezes by in no time.  I actually enjoy doing this dvd.  The music is great and gets you pumped up!  Lots of cardio alternating with toning.  I love doing step on the incline!  Hope there are more workouts using the incline to come.  This is not a beginner step workout.  Or at least if your a beginner you will need time to get the steps down.  its easy to get frustrated when you learn the new steps but they are a blast.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own lots of The Firm videos and this is my absolute favorite. This is a total body workout - cardio & weights. In just 50 minutes you work your whole body and you will see results. Stephanie Huckabee uses fun and easy to follow moves. You'll be surprised how fast time flies during this routine.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I agree with the other reviewers that the compound movements in this DVD are great for working on your body shape; however, the speed at which the movements are performed, lunges, for example, does give one pause.  Although it helps in keeping your heart rate elevated, it does not give the exerciser time to use good form.  I have been told by many trainers, that while weighttraining is excellent, it does not do the job if you are not using proper form.  Jari Love is much better at insuring that the speed in which you work allows for proper form.  Additionally, the ab work done on the incline is challenging--not because the exercises are hard--but because you have to exert arm strength by holding on to the top of the incline, or you slide, quickly, down to the floor.
Title: N/A
